senses.sense_definition: Having a single degree of freedom, typically used in thermodynamics to describe a system where only one condition, such as temperature, can be varied independently without changing the number of phases.

examples.text: In a <w>univariant</w> system, fixing the temperature automatically determines the pressure required to maintain equilibrium.
The phase rule indicates that the coexistence of liquid water and steam represents a <w>univariant</w> equilibrium.
